title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 921-5.2 - Seasonal employment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 921-5.2 - Seasonal employment

State Regulations
(a) Notice is not required if the closing or layoff results from the completion of
a particular seasonal project or undertaking, and the affected employees were
hired with the understanding that their employment was limited to the duration
of the seasonal project or undertaking. (b) The employer must demonstrate that it
informed each employee at the time of hire that the job was seasonal. (c) Employment in an industry that
traditionally hires seasonal employees does not, in and of itself, make an
employee seasonal if the employee was hired to perform a variety of jobs and
tasks continuously through most of the calendar year. Notes
